issue.title: Improved blocks.py efficiency
issue.body: Within blocks.py, I added some line comprehension, simplified boolean expressions, and reduced the # of loops needed for "BASE SYNCHRONICITY CONDITIONS"

issue.title: Generalizing the fork choice to support switches and orbits
issue.body:
Generalizing the fork choice rule so that it works for arbitrary number of shards
Few comments:
     - Launching with `orbit` flag will only run two shards with many orbits
     - Launching with `switch` flag will run 6 shards, do 3-4 switch and no orbits
     - Launching without flags will run 6 shards, one 3-4 switch and two orbits

issue.title: Fixing the inconsistency issues with switching
issue.body:
The most critical bug was in fork_choice -- it was using the parent_ID of the starting node, not the node under consideration (Vlad even mentioned at some point that it was probably the bug)
Also some hackery in the make_block to have proper neighbors at proper times

issue.title: Copying received_log instead of pointing to the same memory solves qu…
issue.body:
…ite a few issues with rotation

I can't find the place where either gets modified, but this definitely solves the issues with nodes not picking up each other after a switch.
With this change and Instant Broadcast switching works like a charm.
Without the instant broadcast it still gets to inconsistent sources.

issue.title: Fixing the fork_choice and early work on switching shards
issue.body:
Switching shards

     - Only supports moving an immediate child to become a child of another immediate child
     - Only one switch right now per simulation (though probably more would work)
     - Some issues still exist (sometimes 3 doesn't get attached to 4 when 1 executed the switch)
